Description: Fragment of a playing card made from several sheets of paper stuck together. One side printed with the image of a 'cavalier of Batons' in black, red, purple and blue-black. Upper part missing. Other side blank.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), B52 room 210 floor 4
Curator's comments: check thickness, 0.05cm not 0.50cm?? Card depicts a 'cavalier of Batons' from a 'Latin-suited' pack (i.e. with Coins, Swords, Batons and Cups), the few examples of which come from Catalonia or the South of France. Cf. Sylvia Mann, Alle Karten auf den Tisch / All cards on the table. Collection / Sammlung Sylvia Mann, Leinfelden-Echterdingen: Deutsches Spielkarten-Museum / Marburg : Jonas, 1990, p. 55 and no. 28), the "Toulouse/Gerona" Pattern.
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
